turns.speaker: LIBBY
turns.text: Nothing unusual about Mr. Sheldon's leaving, Buster--you can tell by the champagne.

turns.speaker: BUSTER
turns.text: Maybe you can, Libby.

turns.speaker: LIBBY
turns.text: No, see, he always ordered a bottle of Dom Perignon when he was ready to go. Then he'd pay up and be out the door.

turns.speaker: BUSTER
turns.text: No long-distance phone calls, Federal Express packages--anything at all out of the ordinary?

turns.speaker: LIBBY
turns.text: I don't think Mr. Sheldon likes for things to be out of the ordinary. Considering who he is and all, famous and all, he doesn't have airs. Drives the same car out from New York each time--'65 Mustang--said it helps him think. He was always a good guest, never made a noise, never bothered a soul. Sure hope nothing happened to him.

turns.speaker: BUSTER
turns.text: So do I...

turns.speaker: LIBBY
turns.text: I'll bet that old Mustang's pulling into New York right now.

turns.speaker: BUSTER
turns.text: I'm sure you're right.

turns.speaker: BUSTER
turns.text: Hey, Pete.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Buster.

turns.speaker: BUSTER
turns.text: Answer me a couple things?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: If I can.

turns.speaker: BUSTER
turns.text: Do you have any of those new Paul Sheldon books?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: We had a batch. Sold 'em all in three days.

turns.speaker: BUSTER
turns.text: You wouldn't happen to remember if Miz Wilkes bought one, would you?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Are you kidding? Every time that fella writes a book, she makes me set aside the first copy.

turns.speaker: BUSTER
turns.text: Has she been buying any odd things lately?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Miz Wilkes? Same old stuff.  --Lest you call paper odd.

turns.speaker: BUSTER
turns.text: Newspapers?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: No, the typing kind.

turns.speaker: BUSTER
turns.text: Oh. That kind. Nothing odd about that.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: An old friend. I was rummaging through a closet and it was just sitting there. Like it was waiting for me.

turns.speaker: SINDELL
turns.text: It's... it's nice, Paul. It's got... character.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: When I wrote my first book, I used to carry it around in this while I was looking for a publisher. That was a good book, Marcia. I was a writer then.

turns.speaker: SINDELL
turns.text: You're still a writer.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I haven't been a writer since I got into the Misery business--

turns.speaker: SINDELL
turns.text: Not a bad business. This thing would still be growing, too. The first printing order on Misery's Child was the most ever--over a million.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Marcia, please.

turns.speaker: SINDELL
turns.text: No, no. Misery Chastain put braces on your daughter's teeth and is putting her through college, bought you two houses and floor seats to the Knick games and what thanks does she get? You go and kill her.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Marcia, you know I started "Misery" on a lark. Do I look like a guy who writes romance novels? Do I sound like Danielle Steel? It was a one- time shot and we got lucky. I never meant it to become my life. And if I hadn't gotten rid of her now, I'd have ended up writing her forever.  For the first time in fifteen years, I think I'm really onto something here.

turns.speaker: SINDELL
turns.text: I'm glad to hear that, Paul, I really am. But you have to know--when your fans find out that you killed off their favorite heroine, they're not going to say, "Ooh, good, Paul Sheldon can finally write what we've always wanted: An esoteric, semi- autobiographical character study.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Marcia, why are you doing this to me? Don't you know I'm scared enough? Don't you think I remember how nobody gave a shit about my first books? You think I'm dying to go back to shouting in the wilderness?  I'm doing this because I have to.  Now, I'm leaving for Colorado to try to finish this and I want your good thoughts--because if I can make it work ...  I might just have something that I want on my tombstone.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Sorry I'm late. Jenny's basketball game went into overtime. If anybody ever told me I'd have a daughter who'd get a triple double, I'd...

turns.speaker: SINDELL
turns.text: Did they win?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Yeah. They're in the semis.

turns.speaker: SINDELL
turns.text: Here it is.  Very first copy.

turns.speaker: SINDELL
turns.text: The word I'm getting is the Times review is gonna be a love letter.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: That'd be a first.

turns.speaker: SINDELL
turns.text: And my contacts at Time and Newsweek tell me they're both raves. And don't laugh--for the first time, I think you've got a shot at some prizes.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Great.

turns.speaker: SINDELL
turns.text: I thought you'd be thrilled. You're being taken seriously.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'm delighted the critics are liking it, and I hope the people like it, too. But it's not why I wrote the book.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I like it. Remember how you once said I live my whole life as if I'm in danger of being found out? Well, I believe I've managed to get that guy down on paper.  Don't think I'm completely nuts, but in some way, Annie Wilkes, that whole experience, helped me.

turns.speaker: SINDELL
turns.text: Paul, since you brought her up, I have to ask you this, or I'd be drummed out of the agents' union-- what about a non-fiction book? The truth about what went on in that house.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Gee, Marcia, if I didn't know you better, I'd think you were suggesting I dredge up the worst horror of my life just so we could make a few bucks.

turns.speaker: SINDELL
turns.text: Now you've hurt me, Paul.

turns.speaker: SINDELL
turns.text: I thought you were over it.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I am. Well, maybe not completely--

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: - pull the NO2 tank and dump it, it's potential evidence..

turns.speaker: STAMP
turns.text: All done, chief..

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: - right -  - don't go too far ahead of me now -

turns.speaker: STAMP
turns.text: Not possible..

turns.speaker: STAMP
turns.text: Not everything.  Why do you think she's really here?

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: From her point of view or mine?

turns.speaker: STAMP
turns.text: Wasn't exactly gagging for it when she left you six months ago..The question is, do you trust her?

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: One considers her timing, of course - getting nicked within a week of the plane going down.  Suggestive, even borderline suspicious, but hardly conclusive.

turns.speaker: STAMP
turns.text: Well, you've thorough about it, at any rate.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: You're not scrutinizing any casual shrug for some hair-splitting nuance, are you?

turns.speaker: STAMP
turns.text: Sean, please..

turns.speaker: STAMP
turns.text: I thought you were going to dinner.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Hugh, take care of the Nekhorvich memory card.

turns.speaker: STAMP
turns.text: Where is it?

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: In the envelope in my pocket.  My right.. jacket..pocket..

turns.speaker: STAMP
turns.text: Afraid he's got no choice.  I believe I broke his jaw.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Hugh, I'm impressed..

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Not much luggage.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: I left in a bit of a hurry.  I'm terribly grateful, Sean.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: How grateful?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Well that depends.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: On what.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: How hard you had to work to get me out of there..how in the world did you ever find me?

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: How I usually find you, Nyah.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: How do you that.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Magic...

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Ahh..

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Your room.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Mmmm.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: And my room?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: You're not interested in seeing how it looks.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Oh, I am.  Later..

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: I said you're beautiful, Nyah.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Only because..it's spring..chalk it up  - to spring fever.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Won't do, love.  It's not spring.  It's nearly autumn..You're in Oz.  everything's upside down and backwards here.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Maybe that's it, then.  Everything's upside down and backwards...

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: You won.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: I suppose I did.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: What made you pick that nag? She'd never won a bloody thing.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: 'Thief in the Night?'

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Say no more.  I'm off to grab a drink. Still favor Bellinis?

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: See anything you like?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Yeah.  Naturally vain -- but they're about to close the betting table and I haven't a sou..

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: To win?

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: What else?

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: You picked another winner!

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Well, that's good, isn't?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Sean, there's something I've been meaning to talk to you about... Isn't going to be easy for me to say.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Then don't say it.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: I don't know what to do about you, Sean. I'm more than a bit muddled.  I need time.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: To do what?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Sort it all out.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: And you're going to have time.  There's been a change of plans.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: A change of plans?

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Yes.  We won't be able to have dinner tonight.  Something's come up.  I hope you don't mind.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Oh, no, not at all.  Maybe just a bit.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Ulrich will be about.  He'll look after you.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Lovely.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Feel like pleading for your life?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Not as much as you feel like hearing it.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: God damn it, Nyah!  Why did you do it?  Why did you save that bastard?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: If it'll make you feel any better I won't do it again.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: If it'll make you feel any better, you're going to take a lot of Aussies with you and make me a lot of money.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: In just a few hours you can be assured of going down in history as the typhoid Mary of Oz.  G'day.

turns.speaker: MCCLOY
turns.text: Bellerophen?  No time at all once I've got it.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Good.  Biocyte stock is just a week or two away from going through the roof.

turns.speaker: MCCLOY
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: An outbreak of Chimera.

turns.speaker: MCCLOY
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: In downtown Sydney for a start.

turns.speaker: MCCLOY
turns.text: Outrageous.  I won't let you take control of my company.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Sit down.  You'll be a billionaire.  Better than being broke.  I've got terrorists and other pharmaceutical companies standing in line.  Ball's in your court, Mr. McCloy.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Nyah!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Billy, make sure Nyah's not followed.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: If you look at Hunt's operational history, he invariably favors misdirection and deception. For a start he won't go into Biocyte from the ground where he has to risk confrontation with security.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Not going in from the ground.  Show me the atrium.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Fight a bit of a cold..

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: And you're happy about that?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Beats fighting the flu, I'm here to tell you.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: You know, that was the hardest part of having to portray you.  Grinning like an idiot every fifteen minutes.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I would've thought the hardest part was exercising restraint.  Curbing that pressing need of your to get your gun off.  You were in such a hurry to knock off that 747, you never figured out where the virus really was.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: I knew where it was.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Oh.  then you knew the only way could smuggle the live virus to the CDC scientists in Atlanta was by injecting himself and using his own bloodstream as a Petri dish, doing it inside of twenty hours so he could take the anti-virus and still have it be effective.  You knew that while you were knocking him off and destroying the very thing you came for.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: There it is, guys, the last of it.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Yep.  You've provided us with a golden opportunity to have both the bug and the bug killer.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: What was the top bid?

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Why, you going to make me a better offer?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Than thirty-seven million pounds?  Not really.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Somebody's been slipping you our mail. Come on out here, you bad girl.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: She doesn't belong here, Sean.  Let her go.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: She wouldn't  be here if it wasn't for you, Hunt.  from this moment you're responsible for what happens to her, and if you're looking out for her well-being, I suggest you advise her to pick up the gun and bring it to me.  Ball's in your court, Hunt.  What've you got to say? Nyah's waiting for your answer.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Oh, Hunt, please! One can't hold Nyah responsible for her actions..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: In other words, you're calling her a flake.

turns.speaker: WALLIS
turns.text: Checkpoint Charlie plus 30, altitude minus two-zero-thousand.  Airspeed one-seven- niner knots..

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: It's that time.  Go.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Not exactly.  Wallis?

turns.speaker: WALLIS
turns.text: More like two-two point two million.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: In any case we don't want your cash.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: -- now here's the way it's going to work..Wallis, the shares outstanding are..

turns.speaker: WALLIS
turns.text: Ninety-three point four million.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Which means, Mr. McCloy, we have to get our hands on four hundred and eighty thousand options.  We'll borrow your thirty million to buy those options.  Your stock's never sold above thirty-one dollars a share.  We'll agree to buy at fifty.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Damn.  Just when it was about to get interesting.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: It's okay.  She scrambled the transmission.  Luther, continue feeding the GPS her position.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What you got there, mate?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: A myth..just a myth...shouldn't you be checking out their countersurveillance?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Well you know his blokes'll place the OSCOR in his annex, where else if you're pinpointing transmitters, video signals, covert chip cameras, anything radiating, oscillating..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: ..or hard wired..

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: - or hard wired, right.  First line of perimeter defence'll run from the back of the dock to the front of the house. Whatever moves burps or bleep is gonna be picked up to a height of twenty feet. Basically impenetrable, I'd say.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Well do you disagree with that?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Not at all.  But how about going into town and confirming your intuitions on site?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Oh well, if that's how you feel about it.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Ambrose is meeting some bloke in the bar. Big bloke, ginger hair. They're into something.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I'll be damned.  It's McCloy, the Biocyte CEO.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Wrong.  All we've got to worry about is Ambrose.  Nyah will take care of Nyah.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Unless we dose her with Bellerophon on the next ninety-seven minutes, Nyah will kill herself.  So, first things, first. Swanbeck said there's no cash movement from any monitored terrorist accounts.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: It is, Billy.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Then we got'em!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Ambrose obviously got these from Nekhorvich on the plane.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: What manic invents  disease like that in the first place?  Why would he do it?

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: So Ambrose has Bellerophon and McCloy's got Chimera.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: There guys are walking around with different halves of the same dollar bill?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Package away in five..four..three.. two..one...

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: I'm not ready!

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Billy.  I think we got a problem.  Nyah's on the wing.  Up early.  Billy, do you copy?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Exactly where is she?

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: ..in the building...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Before we kill her or cure her..

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: We're due to take off.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Not for seven more minutes.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Range is two kay.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I hope there's a place to land.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: There she is.  I got visual.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: We're down to seven minutes 23 seconds..

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: That's it?  That's it? That's it?

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: And the check's in the mall.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Right.  Just remember, mates.  Billy Baird's the name.  Anything you need to get, move or watch, I'm your man.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: I'm booted up.  Go, Ethan.

turns.speaker: BILLY'S VOICE
turns.text: He's heading down the stairs, now..

turns.speaker: BILLY'S VOICE
turns.text: Say again. Sounds like you're saying 'she's in the building.'

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: I am. She is.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: She's in the elevator heading toward Ethan.

turns.speaker: BILLY'S VOICE
turns.text: How much longer before you can reach him?

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Five and a half minutes.  He's breached the hot zone..

turns.speaker: BILLY'S VOICE
turns.text: How're we doin', then?

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: He should've have killed the virus in the incubation area..Nyah's exited the elevator on the same level as the lab.

turns.speaker: BILLY'S VOICE
turns.text: What can we do' mate?

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Hope he kills all the bugs before the yellow dot gets to the red one.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Do you know me?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: No.  Should I?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: No.  You just looked as if you did.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: No.  Just as if I'd like to.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Oh.  Well.  I think that can be arranged.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Not tonight.  Bad timing.  Sorry -

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: There's not enough time in the world for any of it to be bad.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Look, it's either you or the rent and I don't mind telling you it's not an easy choice.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: What if I pay the rent?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Uh-huh?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Think you're the only one who can pick a lock?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: I see.  You're not just another pretty face..

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Would you mind if I'm on top?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Oh, either way works for me.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: - right..where is it?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Far right.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Where's the bloody -

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: - torque wrench.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: - this is very disconerting..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Hey, you put me here.  I just do what I'm told.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: - right..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I wouldn't do that.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Do what?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Under the circumstances I think we would recommend re-setting the senors to respond to a lighter load.  How do you feel about forty kilos, Miss Hall?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Indeed.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Well, Senor de l'Arena, there's no reason to disrupt your party any longer.  we have some further concerns about the disposition of your security guards, which you'll receive in our written report by fax in the morning, hard copy to follow.  Shall we?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: I'm missing something here, aside from a 500,000 pound necklace.  Even after I botched the job, I could've walked out of there with the bloody thing.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: At least you walked.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: If you weren't going to let me get away with it, why did you let me go thru with it?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Wanted to see how good you were. I'm hoping we might work together.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: May I say something, no offence?  You look like a gigolo, you sound like a thief, you act like a cop - what the bloody hell do you have in mind?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Working under adverse conditions.  Highly adverse conditions.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Sounds smashing.  I'm in.  Muchacho, mi carro, por favor!  Now be serious.  You couldn't possibly want me off tonight's performance..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You didn't do that badly.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: You're apologizing for me?  Quite the gentleman..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Not really.  I triggered the alarm..

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Hola..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Hi.  Would you mind slowing down?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Where did you get this number?  I don't even have it!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Pull over and listen to me, will you? Just listen..

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Listen to what?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I need your help and I thin you can use mine.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Your help?  What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Scotland Yard, Interpol, every Dutch authority.  I can make them go away.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Oh bloody hell.  You're a spy.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: What's you name?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Ethan Hunt.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Well, Ethan Hunt, what is it you want to talk to me about?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Awfully short notice..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Care to wait a decent interval?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Who wants to be decent?..

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: When they've got your recruiting technique?  Not a thing.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Oh.  Well..this isn't exactly by the book.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: They've got a book for this?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: They've got a book for everything.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: The only other spook I knew was a liar. Charming but absolutely incapable of telling the truth.  He'd lie about his favorite color.  But then I reckon it's an occupational hazard.  All spies really do is conceal the truth and tell lies.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Not revealing information doesn't necessarily make someone a liar.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: That's not the point.  In the end what spies rely on is the one thing they think they know that you don't.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Which is?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: That they're lying.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: So where did I got right?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: You're not a liar.  Or you're an awfully good one..  ..this thing these blokes pinched..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I don't know that they 'pinched' it. Don't even know that they're blokes.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Well, then, what I am I doing here?  I assume I'm meant to be some sort of thief-to catch-a-thief..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: So do I.  Sort of.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Spoken like a spook..you ever afraid?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Of what?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Ask a question, you get an answer!..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Damn, you're beautiful.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: That's because I'm on my back.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: What's the population of Seville any idea?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Five, six-hundred thousand.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: There's nearly 2 million in London.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: And six billion in the world.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: That's lot of people out there..how many of them, I wonder, are capable of something like that?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Sean Ambrose, for one.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Not that it matter much but..I seem to recall you staying something like, 'I was hoping we could work together.'

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: This wasn't what I had in mind, Nyah.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: But it is what you'd like me to do. so tell me to do it..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Go and insinuate yourself back into Sean's life.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: I'd like a little more conviction..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: So would I.  But it's not mine to give.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: You've either got it or you don't.  Let your conscience be your guide?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Something like that.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: But I don't have a conscience.  I'm a bloody thief.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You can be a thief and have a conscience.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: No.  You can be a thief and have a conscience:  Not me.  Why did you have to tell me about this!  What do I have to do to get away from this guy?  When you're with him, he messes about with your head every waking moment..even now I'll be at some out-of- the-way-place, a tin of caviar and a bottle of Crystal shows up at the table, with two glass, God knows how he finds out at any given moment where I am in the world but he does.  And it looks like he's done it again.  You know his definition of a  true paranoid?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I don't.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Someone in possession of all the facts.  Are you telling me I have to do this?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Generally, I don't favor coercing someone. Not when there's a chance my life could end up in their hands.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: And that's the only reason?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Can you think of a better one?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Not me.  I was just hoping you might..or that..somehow in the course of business this got personal as well as physical.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Look, would it make you feel better if I didn't want you to do this?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Much.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Then feel better!..

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Sean will never be anything but suspicious if he picks up some sort of 'yoo-hoo-I'm- not-nad' message.  Not after the way we broke up.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: What wouldn't make him suspicious?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Probably that I needed him in some urgent way..destitute - in serious trouble..the kind I couldn't possible sort out myself..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Look, I can't run your arrest in CNN, but I guarantee he's monitoring every law enforcement agency in the world, for what they might be saying about him, if nothing else - he's got the ability and, we assume, the desire to get you out of there.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: This doesn't seem to be accomplishing much.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Well, I mean it's not a total loss.  It is keeping a very capable thief off the street..

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Very funny..maybe he has heard and doesn't want to know.  Maybe he's lost interest.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Before you are.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: How can you possibly?  I've got to get right on the plane.  I'm leaving now.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You don't trust me.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Oh, I do.  But as we know I'm a very poor judge of character.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: He's got you on Qantas flight 2735.  It's going to be delayed.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You'll be fine.  I'm going to lose you.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Ethan, you take care of yourself, I'll take care of myself because if push comes to shove, I'm gonna bail - and without giving two week notice.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Well, forewarned is forearmed.  And while we're at it, be especially sensitive to any sudden change in Ambrose's plans, especially any involving you..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: How's it going?  Everything okay?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Just like old times.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Just like old times?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Just about..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: We know him.  He's over your left shoulder, looking right at you as you go on..

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: - Michael, his driver's an Aussie, new to me.  Then there's the blokes in the annex at the back of the house.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Have you met them?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Annex is strictly off limits to me and they never come to the main house, Michael even takes their meals to them all but shoves them under the door.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I've no doubt.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Ambrose has photographs of newspapers with loads of money piled on them -- thirty- seven million on the London Times.  What's that about?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Bids from possible Chimera buyers -- to prove that as of the date on the newspaper those bids are back up by earnest money --

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: -- his left jacket pocket.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Affirmative.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Where do I meet you?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Betting table twelve off the paddock. Nyah, are you up to this?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: I'll muddle through.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: I managed.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You noticed.  What're you going to do? Spank me?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I want you out of there.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Why?  What's happened. What did you see?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Nyah, you've done more than enough.  Even the best of snake charmers get bit.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Ethan, tell me -

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I want you out of Australia!  ..I don't know how much more plainly I can put it.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: How do you suggest I go about it?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: He's touched your heart.  You're overwhelmed.  You need to think it over. You'll meet him somewhere in a month.  If You're not out in 48 hours I'm coming in and getting you out.  Give me the ear piece.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Easy, easy, easy, shhh!

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Oh Ethan!..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: I am now.  Get me out of here.  Just get me out of here.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: It's going to be okay.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Ethan, you know what frightens me most when I'm with him?..the thought of never seeing you..how are we getting out of here?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Nyah, it's very important not do anything to alarm Ambrose..

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: What?  You told me to get out of here.  I thought you were here to collect me.  I was so relieved.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: No time to explain.  You've done well, and we're so close.  So close.  It's critical that you do whatever Ambrose asks.  Don't worry - it'll be over soon.. That's a promise.. Come on, now off you go!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: What did you think you were doing!

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: I wasn't thinking!  Just..trying to keep you from getting hurt, that's all.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: - you who don't have a conscience.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: I guess I lied..You can't get both of us out of here, can you?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: Then you'll have to kill me before it's too late.  Before I start killing people.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: I'm infected with Chimera.  You know you don't have a choice.  Just do it now.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: No.  Should I?

turns.speaker: NYAH
turns.text: No.  You just looked as if you did.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Sorry I didn't let you know where I was.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Don't be.  Wouldn't be on vacation if you did.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Well.  You're sorry and I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Why did you phrase it like that?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: 'You're sorry and I'm sorry.'

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You gotta be kidding.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: An idea, yeah.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Like?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Like it's a good idea to pick him up in a hurry.  And a bad idea to fly him on a commercial carrier.  So let's get on with it.  He's still in Sydney?

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Dr. Vladimir Nekhorvich is dead.  So is his colleague, Gradski, but that happened earlier.  We had Nekhorvich on a flight from Sydney that crashed in the Rockies..
